intro: Tetracera nitida, commonly known as the slender tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with smooth, glabrous stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. Tetracera nitida is often found in moist, shaded areas in tropical forests.
